Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto and verso. Seven fragments, the right half ofthe papyrus is particulalry damaged. Two documents onn recto, A complete (9 ll.) and B incomplete (portions of 10 ll.); names of 7 witnesses on verso. Dated year 35, Hathyr 25, of the joint reign of Ptolemy VIII Euergetes II, Kleopatra II and Kleopatra III. A: cession of a room and a workshop in Djeme (Medinet Habu) by Paynakhti son of Piboukhis to Kollouthes son of Siephmous; scribe Paes son of Peteesis. B: fragmentary sale and receipt of the same.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.78-81, pl.65-6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (48644) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/48644)
